title: Establishing a Second Emergency Board To Investigate a Dispute Between New Jersey Transit Rail Operations and Its Locomotive Engineers Represented by the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a second emergency board to investigate and help resolve an ongoing labor dispute between New Jersey Transit Rail Operations and its locomotive engineers represented by the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen. The board will review the parties’ final offers and recommend the most reasonable settlement to the President, while the dispute remains under mediation and strikes or other changes to working conditions are temporarily halted.
potential_concerns: The delay caused by repeated emergency boards may prolong the labor dispute, disrupting transit services.
If the board's recommendations are not accepted, the continued stalemate could worsen tensions between labor and management.
The restriction on changing work conditions during the dispute limits negotiating leverage for both parties.
Resource constraints could impact the board’s effectiveness in thoroughly investigating the dispute.
Employers and transit riders may be negatively affected if the dispute leads to service interruptions.
